Definition: You are given a context and a verb in separate lines. Your task is to find whether the given verbâ€™s usage in the context shows that the verb definitely happens at some point of time (in the past, present or future) (called as anchoring in time). If it does, answer "Yes" otherwise "No".

Positive Examples.input:
Last year , Russian officials assailed Ukraine for holding joint naval exercises with NATO in the Black Sea, an area Moscow considers its own turf. Kuchma has said repeatedly that Ukraine would (remain) neutral for the foreseeable future. 
 Verb: remain
Positive Examples.explanation: Here the verb remain is expected to happen in the future for sure. So, it is anchorable.

Positive Examples.input:
"But there is no evidence in either direction that there is proof of life or death ," said a Foreign Office spokesman , speaking with customary anonymity. " We will continue to do everything we can to (establish) what has happened ." 
 Verb: establish
Positive Examples.explanation: There is no surity to say that the given verb happens definetely at some point of time. So it is not anchorable.

Negative Examples.input:
Kuchma has said repeatedly that Ukraine would remain neutral for the foreseeable future .

Yeltsin and Kuchma also (called) for developing the stagnant relations between the members of the Commonwealth of Independent States , a loose coalition of former Soviet republics . Verb: called
Negative Examples.explanation: The verb 'called' is anchorable in the sentence as it happened in the past. So the answer should be Yes.

Negative Examples.input:
Another suspect is awaiting extradition from Britain . The FBI says Bin Laden (is) the leader of a terrorist organization known as Al-Aqeda , "The Base ."  
 Verb :is
Negative Examples.explanation: In this sentence, the verb 'is' is not anchorable. So, the answer should be No.

Instances.input:
Last year , Russian officials assailed Ukraine for holding joint naval exercises with NATO in the Black Sea _ an area Moscow considers its own turf . Kuchma has said repeatedly that Ukraine would (remain) neutral for the foreseeable future . 
 Verb: remain

Kuchma has said repeatedly that Ukraine would remain neutral for the foreseeable future . Yeltsin and Kuchma also (called) for developing the stagnant relations between the members of the Commonwealth of Independent States , a loose coalition of former Soviet republics . 
 Verb: called

Yeltsin and Kuchma also called for developing the stagnant relations between the members of the Commonwealth of Independent States , a loose coalition of former Soviet republics . In the past , Russia has often (claimed) that Ukraine was undermining efforts at closer cooperation within the CIS . 
 Verb: claimed

Yeltsin and Kuchma also called for developing the stagnant relations between the members of the Commonwealth of Independent States , a loose coalition of former Soviet republics . In the past , Russia has often claimed that Ukraine was (undermining) efforts at closer cooperation within the CIS . 
 Verb: undermining

In the past , Russia has often claimed that Ukraine was undermining efforts at closer cooperation within the CIS . A major goal of Kuchma 's four-day state visit was the signing of a 10-year economic program (aimed) at doubling the two nations ' trade turnover , which fell to dlrs 14 billion last year , down dlrs 2.5 billion from 1996 . 
 Verb: aimed

In the past , Russia has often claimed that Ukraine was undermining efforts at closer cooperation within the CIS . A major goal of Kuchma 's four-day state visit was the signing of a 10-year economic program aimed at doubling the two nations ' trade turnover , which (fell) to dlrs 14 billion last year , down dlrs 2.5 billion from 1996 . 
 Verb: fell

A major goal of Kuchma 's four-day state visit was the signing of a 10-year economic program aimed at doubling the two nations ' trade turnover , which fell to dlrs 14 billion last year , down dlrs 2.5 billion from 1996 . The two presidents on Friday (signed) the plan , which calls for cooperation in the metallurgy , fuel , energy , aircraft building , missile , space and chemical industries . 
 Verb: signed

A major goal of Kuchma 's four-day state visit was the signing of a 10-year economic program aimed at doubling the two nations ' trade turnover , which fell to dlrs 14 billion last year , down dlrs 2.5 billion from 1996 . The two presidents on Friday signed the plan , which (calls) for cooperation in the metallurgy , fuel , energy , aircraft building , missile , space and chemical industries . 
 Verb: calls

The two presidents on Friday signed the plan , which calls for cooperation in the metallurgy , fuel , energy , aircraft building , missile , space and chemical industries . A major project is joint manufacturing of An-70 cargo planes , the Kremlin statement (said) . 
 Verb: said

A major project is joint manufacturing of An-70 cargo planes , the Kremlin statement said . The program also (calls) for coordination of economic reforms and joint improvement of social programs in the two countries , where many people have become impoverished during the chaotic post-Soviet transition to capitalism . 
 Verb: calls

The program also calls for coordination of economic reforms and joint improvement of social programs in the two countries , where many people have become impoverished during the chaotic post-Soviet transition to capitalism . Kuchma also (planned) to visit Russian gas giant Gazprom , most likely to discuss Ukraine 's dlrs 1.2 billion debt to the company . 
 Verb: planned
